systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

identity.Description: The managed identity for the Video Analyzer resource.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

storageAccounts.Description: The storage accounts for this resource.

endpoints.Description: The list of endpoints associated with this resource.

encryption.Description: Defines how the Video Analyzer account is (optionally) encrypted.

id.Description: The ID of the storage account resource. Video Analyzer relies on tables, queues, and blobs. The primary storage account must be a Standard Storage account (either Microsoft.ClassicStorage or Microsoft.Storage).

identity.Description: The user assigned managed identity to use when accessing a resource.

status.Description: The current status of the storage account mapping.

userAssignedIdentity.Description: The user assigned managed identity's resource identifier to use when accessing a resource.

type.Description: The type of key used to encrypt the Account Key.

keyVaultProperties.Description: The details for accessing the encryption keys in Key Vault.

identity.Description: The user assigned managed identity to use when accessing a resource.

status.Description: The current status of the Key Vault mapping.

keyIdentifier.Description: The URL of the Key Vault key used to encrypt the account. The key may either be versioned (for example https://vault/keys/mykey/version1) or reference a key without a version (for example https://vault/keys/mykey).

currentKeyIdentifier.Description: The current key used to encrypt Video Analyzer account, including the key version.

createdBy.Description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.Description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedAt.Description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

properties.Description: Application level properties for the edge module resource.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

edgeModuleId.Description: Internal ID generated for the instance of the Video Analyzer edge module.

properties.Description: Application level properties for the video resource.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

title.Description: Optional video title provided by the user. Value can be up to 256 characters long.

description.Description: Optional video description provided by the user. Value can be up to 2048 characters long.

type.Description: Type of the video archive. Different archive formats provide different capabilities.

flags.Description: Video flags contain information about the available video actions and its dynamic properties based on the current video state.

streaming.Description: Video streaming holds information about video streaming URLs.

mediaInfo.Description: Contains information about the video and audio content.

canStream.Description: Value indicating whether or not the video can be streamed. Only "archive" type videos can be streamed.

hasData.Description: Value indicating whether or not there has ever been data recorded or uploaded into the video. Newly created videos have this value set to false.

isRecording.Description: Value indicating whether or not the video is currently being referenced be an active live pipeline. The fact that is being referenced, doesn't necessarily indicate that data is being received. For example, video recording may be gated on events or camera may not be accessible at the time.

archiveBaseUrl.Description:
Video streaming base URL for the video archive. When present, archived video can be played through the Azure Video Analyzer player. Alternatively, this URL can be used with compatible DASH or HLS players by appending the following to the base URL:

  - HLSv4:     /manifest(format=m3u8-aapl).m3u8
  - HLS CMAF:  /manifest(format=m3u8-cmaf)
  - DASH CMAF: /manifest(format=mpd-time-cmaf)

Moreover, an ongoing video recording can be played in "live mode" with latencies which are approximately double of the chosen video segment length.

segmentLength.Description: Video segment length indicates the length of individual video files (segments) which are persisted to storage. Smaller segments provide lower archive playback latency but generate larger volume of storage transactions. Larger segments reduce the amount of storage transactions while increasing the archive playback latency. Value must be specified in ISO8601 duration format (i.e. "PT30S" equals 30 seconds) and can vary between 30 seconds to 5 minutes, in 30 seconds increments.

properties.Description: Application level properties for the access policy resource.

systemData.Description: Metadata pertaining to creation and last modification of the resource.

role.Description: Defines the access level granted by this policy.

authentication.Description: Base class for access policies authentication methods.

issuers.Description: List of expected token issuers. Token issuer is valid if it matches at least one of the given values.

audiences.Description: List of expected token audiences. Token audience is valid if it matches at least one of the given values.

claims.Description: List of additional token claims to be validated. Token must contains all claims and respective values for it to be valid.

keys.Description: List of keys which can be used to validate access tokens. Having multiple keys allow for seamless key rotation of the token signing key. Token signature must match exactly one key.

name.Description: Name of the claim which must be present on the token.

value.Description: Expected value of the claim to be present on the token.

kid.Description: JWT token key id. Validation keys are looked up based on the key id present on the JWT token header.

alg.Description: Elliptical curve algorithm to be used: ES256, ES384 or ES512.
RSA algorithm to be used: RS256, RS384 or RS512.
